    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int[] autofitHistograms(java.util.List<org.opencv.core.Mat> histograms)
      applies HISTOGRAM_AUTOFIT_THRESHOLD to given histogram
      void buildFab()
      create floating main button and floating menu, which is activated through a click on the main button
      void buildRangeSeekBars()
      create RangeSeekBars for setting HSV ranges in HSV Filter mode
      java.util.List<org.opencv.core.Mat> calcHsvHistograms()
      calculates hsv histograms and feedback graph and puts the feedback graph of the color histograms (hue, saturation) into a copy of mRgba (mIntermediateMat), so it can also be done in the background without affecting the live frame (needs rgba copy in mIntermediateMat, which is converted to mHsv)
      boolean compareHsHistograms(FruitType ft, java.util.List<org.opencv.core.Mat> candidateHistograms)
      find closest match to picture --> hs color histogram comparison with specified method
      org.opencv.core.Scalar[] createEvenHueScalar(int size)
      creates an array of scalars, according to defined size, with an even color range for the visualization of hue vector values
      void detectFruitType(FruitType ft)
      executes the whole fruit detection process, shows histograms and mask in hsv mode
      void dialogInputSaveFruitType()
      Creates a dialog box and asks for a name of the currently filtered object afterwards saves the object with calculated histograms as a fruit type, locally and also as an update in the database
      void drawHistograms(java.util.List<org.opencv.core.Mat> histograms)
      draws the two first histograms from a given list
      java.util.List<org.opencv.core.MatOfPoint> findContoursAboveThreshold(boolean isOnlyBiggestDesired)
      finds biggest contour in mHsvThreshed (binary mask from hsv threshold filtering) above the defined threshold, or even all contours above this threshold, depending on the parameter isOnlyBiggestDesired
      void getHsvFilterMask(int[] hsvFilterValues)
      applies defined filter values to hsv image, copies result to intermediate mat also be done in the background - another result is a binary mask (mask is saved in mHsvThreshed) (modified global variable: mIntermediateMat gets original rgba values) (modified global variable: mHsv gets hsv values from original rgba values) (modified global variable: mHsvThreshed gets mask from hsv image with applied hsv filter values)
      NutritionalValue getNutritionalValue(java.lang.String name)
      delivers the nutritional value from a food with the specified name the result is depending on the name of the object and is hard-coded for the demonstration purposes - a crawler would be a better solution
      void handleDetectedFruit(Fruit f, boolean isContourDesired)
      handle the detected fruit: draw contour, line and label
      void handleHsvMode()
      handles the hsv mode: applies mask to live screen, depending on the hsv filter values of the range seek bars, also show color histogram of the filtered image
      void initializeFromDatabase()
      initialize fruitTypes with saved values from database
      org.opencv.core.Mat onCameraFrame(org.opencv.android.CameraBridgeViewBase.CvCameraViewFrame inputFrame)
      starting point for every frame, arranges steps depending on the active mode
      void onCameraViewStarted(int width, int height)
      initializes all mats, scalars and other variables, which are needed for the frame processing
      void onCameraViewStopped()
      cleanup operations, when camera view stops
      void onClick(View v)
      handle onClick events, such as the manipulation of hsv filter values
      void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState)
      executes various initialization operations - initializes camera view from opencv - initializes fruit type list with data from database - initializes user interface
      void onDestroy()
      cleanup operations, if app is resumed
      void onPause()
      cleanup operations, if app is paused
      void onResume()
      cleanup operations, if app is resumed
      boolean onTouch(View arg0, MotionEvent event)
      handle onTouch events (such as displaying nutritional values to a touched fruit)
      void saveFruitType(java.lang.String name)
      saves fruit type with given name gives feedback, if name was empty and nothing was saved
      void setHsvModeGuiVisibility(boolean isVisible)
      makes all declared gui elements of the hsv mode visible or invisible, as defined
      void setLinearLayoutVisibility(boolean visible, LinearLayout layoutParent)
      function for visibility setting of all seekbars in defined LinearLayout
      void setRangeBarValues(int[] values)
      updates range bar values to the ones defines in the transfer variable
      java.lang.String testHistogramComparisonMethods(FruitType ft, java.util.List<org.opencv.core.Mat> candidateHistograms)
      method for testing all histogram comparison methods from opencv with given fruit type on live frames

        Specified by:

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • setLinearLayoutVisibility

        public void setLinearLayoutVisibility(boolean visible,
                                      LinearLayout layoutParent)
        function for visibility setting of all seekbars in defined LinearLayout
        Parameters:
        visible - determines, if items are made visible or gone (invisible-like)
        layoutParent - determines layout parent item, whose children are made (in-)visible

      • createEvenHueScalar

        public org.opencv.core.Scalar[] createEvenHueScalar(int size)
        creates an array of scalars, according to defined size, with an even color range for the visualization of hue vector values
        Parameters:
        size - specifies the size of the scalar vector

      • handleHsvMode

        public void handleHsvMode()
        handles the hsv mode: applies mask to live screen, depending on the hsv filter values of the range seek bars, also show color histogram of the filtered image

      • detectFruitType

        public void detectFruitType(FruitType ft)
        executes the whole fruit detection process, shows histograms and mask in hsv mode
        Parameters:
        ft - defines fruit type, for which the check occures

      • getHsvFilterMask

        public void getHsvFilterMask(int[] hsvFilterValues)
        applies defined filter values to hsv image, copies result to intermediate mat also be done in the background - another result is a binary mask (mask is saved in mHsvThreshed) (modified global variable: mIntermediateMat gets original rgba values) (modified global variable: mHsv gets hsv values from original rgba values) (modified global variable: mHsvThreshed gets mask from hsv image with applied hsv filter values)
        Parameters:
        hsvFilterValues - defines the min/max values for h, s and v filtering

      • calcHsvHistograms

        public java.util.List<org.opencv.core.Mat> calcHsvHistograms()
        calculates hsv histograms and feedback graph and puts the feedback graph of the color histograms (hue, saturation) into a copy of mRgba (mIntermediateMat), so it can also be done in the background without affecting the live frame (needs rgba copy in mIntermediateMat, which is converted to mHsv)

      • drawHistograms

        public void drawHistograms(java.util.List<org.opencv.core.Mat> histograms)
        draws the two first histograms from a given list
        Parameters:
        histograms - defines list containing histograms

      • autofitHistograms

        public int[] autofitHistograms(java.util.List<org.opencv.core.Mat> histograms)
        applies HISTOGRAM_AUTOFIT_THRESHOLD to given histogram
        Parameters:
        histograms - histograms, to which autofit should be applied
        Returns:
        returns a vector of new filter values

      • compareHsHistograms

        public boolean compareHsHistograms(FruitType ft,
                                   java.util.List<org.opencv.core.Mat> candidateHistograms)
        find closest match to picture --> hs color histogram comparison with specified method
        Returns:
        returns the detected FruitType, which is most likely the captured fruit

      • findContoursAboveThreshold

        public java.util.List<org.opencv.core.MatOfPoint> findContoursAboveThreshold(boolean isOnlyBiggestDesired)
        finds biggest contour in mHsvThreshed (binary mask from hsv threshold filtering) above the defined threshold, or even all contours above this threshold, depending on the parameter isOnlyBiggestDesired
        Parameters:
        isOnlyBiggestDesired - defines, if the task is to find the biggest contour or all above the threshold
        Returns:
        list of contours with biggest contour only are all above the threshold

      • handleDetectedFruit

        public void handleDetectedFruit(Fruit f,
                                boolean isContourDesired)
        handle the detected fruit: draw contour, line and label
        Parameters:
        f - fruit, which should be handled
        isContourDesired - determines, if contour should be drawn

      • testHistogramComparisonMethods

        public java.lang.String testHistogramComparisonMethods(FruitType ft,
                                                       java.util.List<org.opencv.core.Mat> candidateHistograms)
        method for testing all histogram comparison methods from opencv with given fruit type on live frames
        Parameters:
        ft - FruitType, which histogram is compared with the live screen
        Returns:
        comparisonResults String with all formatted results, can be used for the log

      • dialogInputSaveFruitType

        public void dialogInputSaveFruitType()
        Creates a dialog box and asks for a name of the currently filtered object afterwards saves the object with calculated histograms as a fruit type, locally and also as an update in the database

      • saveFruitType

        public void saveFruitType(java.lang.String name)
        saves fruit type with given name gives feedback, if name was empty and nothing was saved
        Parameters:
        name - defines name of the to be saved fruit type

      • setHsvModeGuiVisibility

        public void setHsvModeGuiVisibility(boolean isVisible)
        makes all declared gui elements of the hsv mode visible or invisible, as defined
        Parameters:
        isVisible - distinguishes if goal of actions is visibility or invisibility

      • getNutritionalValue

        public NutritionalValue getNutritionalValue(java.lang.String name)
        delivers the nutritional value from a food with the specified name the result is depending on the name of the object and is hard-coded for the demonstration purposes - a crawler would be a better solution
        Parameters:
        name - specifies name of the food
